wiki.content:
Thelonious Monk composed the jazz standard Epistrophy, often considered his signature tune, in 1942. It appears on several studio albums and is a constant in his live shows. Its angular and slightly discordant style show a break with previous jazz forms, as well as with contemporaneous bebop composers. In addition to providing a perfect showcase for Monk's improvisations, though, the driving yet slightly off-balance tune has proven consistently popular and is now a standard among jazz musicians everywhere.
        
User-contributed text is available under the Creative Commons By-SA License and may also be available under the GNU FDL.
wiki.summary: Thelonious Monk composed the jazz standard Epistrophy, often considered his signature tune, in 1942. It appears on several studio albums and is a constant in his live shows. Its angular and slightly discordant style show a break with previous jazz forms, as well as with contemporaneous bebop composers. In addition to providing a perfect showcase for Monk's improvisations, though, the driving yet slightly off-balance tune has proven consistently popular and is now a standard among jazz musicians everywhere.

track.name: Epistrophy
comments: not as jazzy as Im2jazzy4U and I love Monk's playing
how much you miss multicolouredb...how much you miss...
Hard to sit still for this one.....so I won't! Superb!
I am decorating my house in advance of my daughters visit. DANCING!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
Still not enamoured by Monk!!!!!!!!!!

! Just how many times did he record it ? www.last.fm/search/overview?q=Thelonious+Monk+Epistrophy&type=track&page=1 ~~~ Which are peoples' favourites and why? (And where should the apostrophe(Epistrophy  ;-)?  ) go?)
110914 only about 2:00 long
OMG! This is the real deal! So swingy i can´t sit still!
last.fm never seems to know how long these Monk songs are haha
Oh my god.

Both versions of this song on the concert with John Coltrane at Carnegie Hall sound so different than this one... It all sounds very melancholy in a Taxi Driver soundtrack kind of way. I love them both, and my appreciation for them depends on my mood. I have yet to understand what makes the arrangement sound so characteristically different played at that concert.
lovely on this dreary ol day.
great stuff
smart!
Marvellous!!
